formalText: Things are not too good.
She doesn't know what to do.
She keeps thinking things will get better.
Things just don't get better.
She thinks a lot about killing herself and she's not sure she has the courage
to do it.
That's one way out.
It just seems like there's no good way out of this.
She was feeling hopeful.
She wants that back.
She was talking about getting help and this was after she was starting to feel a little bit better in the hospital.
She felt like she had to leave because she felt a little better.
She didn't feel like she deserved it anymore.
Once she's feeling well enough to possibly not need that anymore, it made her feel guilty.
She intends to survive but the hopelessness is just so convincing.
She very much wants to give up and wants not to give up.
She doesn't know.
It's really hard.
She doesn't know how she's going to bear it for the minute, let alone for years to come.
She can do it for the next minute.
Just not much longer.
It's just really grim.
She's afraid she's not going to make it.
She's afraid she'll kill herself.
It would be the best thing that she never did.
So obviously she's quite scared
and pretty helpless.
She thinks she can wait.
